thread.title: Class D playoff preview: Tioga vs. Oxford
thread.title_full: Class D playoff preview: Tioga vs. Oxford

title: Class D playoff preview: Tioga vs. Oxford
text:
Class D playoff preview: Tioga vs. Oxford 
By wbng sports October 20, 2015 Updated Oct 20, 2015 at 1:31 AM EDT 
(WBNG Binghamton) Oxford (4-3) faces a tall task in trying to knock four-time defending champion Tioga (6-1) from the postseason in the Class D sectional quarterfinals. 
By now, most know plenty about Tioga's vaunted rushing attack, led by Section IV's all-time leading rusher, Jesse Manuel. The part about that running game that impresses the most isn't just how good it is, but how explosive it is. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
The thing that stands out about the Tigers is this: with 338 points scored, they've averaged about 48 points per game this year. Not only is that the best in Class D around here, but it's the second most in all of Section IV. Only Elmira has scored more than Tioga. 
If the Blackhawks want to pull the upset, they may need to make it a defensive battle. They're capable of doing that -- they've allowed just under 18 points per game, good for third-best in Class D. 
Tioga and Oxford played each other in Week 7, with the Tigers winning 43-26. 
The rematch is set for Friday, Oct. 23 at 7 p.m. at Tioga.
